00055   class MESQUITE_EXPORT Vector3D
00056   {
00057   public:
00058     // Constructors
00059     Vector3D();
00060     Vector3D( double xyz );
00061     Vector3D( double x, double y, double z);
00062     Vector3D(const double xyz[3]);
00063     Vector3D(const Vector3D& to_copy);
00064 
00065     // *** virtual destructor *** Do not use for Vector3D, we need to keep
00066     // the deallocation of those objects very fast
00067     
00068     // Functions to get the coordinates
00069     double x() const;
00070     double y() const;
00071     double z() const;
00072     void get_coordinates(double& x, double& y, double& z) const;
00073     void get_coordinates(double xyz[3]) const;
00074     const double& operator[](size_t index) const; // 0-based
00075     
00076     // Functions to set the coordinates.
00077     void x(const double x);
00078     void y(const double y);
00079     void z(const double z);
00080     void set(const double x, const double y, const double z);
00081     void set(const double xyz[3]);

00083     // Subscripts on non-consts both get and set coords
00084     double& operator[](size_t index); // 0-based
00085     Vector3D& operator=(const Vector3D &to_copy);
00086     Vector3D& operator=(const double &to_copy);
00087

00089     Vector3D operator-() const;  //- unary negation.
00090     Vector3D& operator*=(const double scalar);
00091     Vector3D& operator/=(const double scalar);
00092     Vector3D& operator*=(const Vector3D &rhs); //- cross product
00093     Vector3D& operator+=(const Vector3D &rhs);
00094     Vector3D& operator-=(const Vector3D &rhs);
00095     
00096     // Binary operators (like a+b).
00097     friend const Vector3D operator+(const Vector3D &lhs,
00098                               const Vector3D &rhs);
00099     friend const Vector3D operator-(const Vector3D &lhs,
00100                               const Vector3D &rhs);

00102                               const double scalar); 
00103     friend const Vector3D operator*(const double scalar,
00104                               const Vector3D &rhs);

00106                               const double scalar); //- lhs / scalar
00107     friend double operator%(const Vector3D &v1,
00108                             const Vector3D &v2); 
00109     friend double inner(const Vector3D v1[],
00110                         const Vector3D v2[], int n); 
00111     friend double operator%(const double scalar,
00112                             const Vector3D &v2);

00114                             const double scalar);

00116                               const Vector3D &v2); 
00117  
00119     friend void eqAx(Vector3D& v, const Matrix3D& A, const Vector3D& x);
00121     friend void plusEqAx(Vector3D& v, const Matrix3D& A, const Vector3D& x);
00123     friend void plusEqTransAx(Vector3D& v, const Matrix3D& A, const Vector3D& x);

00125     
00126     // Comparison functions
00127     friend bool operator==(const Vector3D &lhs, const Vector3D &rhs);
00128     friend bool operator!=(const Vector3D &lhs, const Vector3D &rhs);

00130                                    const Vector3D& p2);
00131     int within_tolerance_box(const Vector3D &compare_to,
00132                              double tolerance) const;
00133     //- Compare two Vector3Ds to see if they are spatially equal.  
00134     // Return TRUE if difference in x, y, and z are all within tolerance.
00135     // Essentially checks to see if 'this' lies within a box centered on
00136     // 'compare_to' with sides of length ('tolerance' * 2).
00137 
00138     // Length functions
00139     inline double length_squared() const;
00140     inline double length() const;
00141     friend  double length(const Vector3D* v,int n); 
00142     friend  double Linf(const Vector3D* v,int n); 
00143 
00144     inline void set_length(const double new_length);
00145     inline void normalize();
00146     Vector3D operator~() const { return *this * (1.0/length()); }
00147     
00148     // Utility functions.  All angle functions work in radians.
00149     static double interior_angle(const Vector3D &a,
00150                                  const Vector3D &b,
00151                                  MsqError& err);
00152     //- Interior angle: acos((a%b)/(|a||b|))
00153     static Vector3D interpolate(const double param, const Vector3D &p1,
00154                                 const Vector3D &p2);
00155     //- Interpolate between two points. Returns (1-param)*v1 + param*v2.
00156 
00157     const double* to_array() const 
00158       { return mCoords; }
00159 
00160     double* to_array() 
00161       { return mCoords; }
00162 
00163   protected:
00164     double mCoords[3];
00165   };

00172     mCoords[2] = 0;

00190   inline Vector3D::Vector3D(const Vector3D& to_copy)

00199   { return mCoords[2]; }

00201   {

00203     y = mCoords[1]; 
00204     z = mCoords[2];

00245   {
00246     mCoords[0] = to_copy;
00247     mCoords[1] = to_copy;
00248     mCoords[2] = to_copy;
00249     return *this;

00252   // Functions that modify existing coordinates
00253   inline Vector3D Vector3D::operator-() const
00254   {
00255     return Vector3D(-mCoords[0], -mCoords[1], -mCoords[2]);
00256   }
00257   inline Vector3D& Vector3D::operator*=(const double scalar)
00258   {
00259     mCoords[0] *= scalar;
00260     mCoords[1] *= scalar;
00261     mCoords[2] *= scalar;
00262     return *this;
00263   }
00265   inline Vector3D& Vector3D::operator/=(const double scalar)
00266   {
00267     mCoords[0] /= scalar;
00268     mCoords[1] /= scalar;
00269     mCoords[2] /= scalar;
00270     return *this;
00271   }
00272   inline Vector3D& Vector3D::operator*=(const Vector3D &rhs)
00273   {
00274     double new_coords[3] = 
00275       {mCoords[1]*rhs.mCoords[2] - mCoords[2]*rhs.mCoords[1],
00276        mCoords[2]*rhs.mCoords[0] - mCoords[0]*rhs.mCoords[2],
00277        mCoords[0]*rhs.mCoords[1] - mCoords[1]*rhs.mCoords[0]
00278       };
00279     std::memcpy(mCoords, new_coords, 3*sizeof(double));
00280     return *this;
00281   }
00282   inline Vector3D& Vector3D::operator+=(const Vector3D &rhs)
00283   {
00284     mCoords[0] += rhs.mCoords[0];
00285     mCoords[1] += rhs.mCoords[1];
00286     mCoords[2] += rhs.mCoords[2];
00287     return *this;
00288   }
00289   inline Vector3D& Vector3D::operator-=(const Vector3D &rhs)
00290   {
00291     mCoords[0] -= rhs.mCoords[0];
00292     mCoords[1] -= rhs.mCoords[1];
00293     mCoords[2] -= rhs.mCoords[2];
00294     return *this;
00295   }

00297   // Binary operators
00298   inline const Vector3D operator+(const Vector3D &lhs,
00299                             const Vector3D &rhs)
00300   {
00301     return Vector3D(lhs.x() + rhs.x(),
00302                     lhs.y() + rhs.y(),
00303                     lhs.z() + rhs.z());
00304   }
00305   inline const Vector3D operator-(const Vector3D &lhs,
00306                             const Vector3D &rhs)
00307   {
00308     return Vector3D(lhs.x() - rhs.x(),
00309                     lhs.y() - rhs.y(),
00310                     lhs.z() - rhs.z());
00311   }
00312   inline const Vector3D operator*(const Vector3D &lhs,
00313                             const double scalar)
00314   {
00315     return Vector3D(lhs.x() * scalar,
00316                     lhs.y() * scalar,
00317                     lhs.z() * scalar);
00318   }
00319   inline const Vector3D operator*(const double scalar,
00320                             const Vector3D &rhs)
00321   {
00322     return Vector3D(rhs.x() * scalar,
00323                     rhs.y() * scalar,
00324                     rhs.z() * scalar);
00325   }
00326   inline const Vector3D operator/(const Vector3D &lhs,
00327                             const double scalar)
00328   {
00329     assert (scalar != 0);
00330     return Vector3D(lhs.x() / scalar,
00331                     lhs.y() / scalar,
00332                     lhs.z() / scalar);
00333   }
00334   inline double operator%(const Vector3D &lhs,
00335                           const Vector3D &rhs) // Dot Product
00336   {
00337     return( lhs.mCoords[0] * rhs.mCoords[0] +
00338             lhs.mCoords[1] * rhs.mCoords[1] +
00339             lhs.mCoords[2] * rhs.mCoords[2] );
00340   }
00341 
00343   inline double inner(const Vector3D lhs[],
00344                       const Vector3D rhs[], int n)
00345   {
00346     int i;
00347     double dot=0;
00348     for (i=0; i<n; ++i) 
00349       dot+= lhs[i].mCoords[0] * rhs[i].mCoords[0] +
00350             lhs[i].mCoords[1] * rhs[i].mCoords[1] +
00351             lhs[i].mCoords[2] * rhs[i].mCoords[2];
00352     return dot;
00353   }
00355   inline double inner(const std::vector<Vector3D>& lhs,
00356                       const std::vector<Vector3D>& rhs)
00357   {
00358     double dot = 0;
00359     assert(lhs.size() == rhs.size());
00360     for (size_t i = 0; i < lhs.size(); ++i)
00361       dot = lhs[i] % rhs[i];
00362     return dot;
00363   }
00364 
00365   inline double operator%(const double scalar,
00366                           const Vector3D &rhs) // Dot Product
00367   {
00368     return( scalar * (rhs.mCoords[0] + rhs.mCoords[1] + rhs.mCoords[2]) );
00369   }
00370   inline double operator%(const Vector3D &lhs,
00371                           const double scalar) // Dot Product
00372   {
00373     return( scalar * (lhs.mCoords[0] + lhs.mCoords[1] + lhs.mCoords[2]) );
00374   }
00375   inline const Vector3D operator*(const Vector3D &lhs, 
00376                             const Vector3D &rhs) // Cross Product
00377   {
00378     return Vector3D(lhs.mCoords[1]*rhs.mCoords[2]-lhs.mCoords[2]*rhs.mCoords[1],
00379                     lhs.mCoords[2]*rhs.mCoords[0]-lhs.mCoords[0]*rhs.mCoords[2],
00380                     lhs.mCoords[0]*rhs.mCoords[1]-lhs.mCoords[1]*rhs.mCoords[0]);
00381   }

00384   MESQUITE_EXPORT std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const Mesquite::Vector3D &v);
00385   
00386   inline double Vector3D::distance_between(const Vector3D &p1,
00387                                            const Vector3D &p2)
00388   {
00389     Vector3D v = p2 - p1;
00390     return v.length();
00391   }
00392   inline int Vector3D::within_tolerance_box(const Vector3D &compare_to,
00393                                             double tolerance) const
00394   {
00395     return ((std::fabs(this->mCoords[0] - compare_to.mCoords[0]) < tolerance) &&
00396             (std::fabs(this->mCoords[1] - compare_to.mCoords[1]) < tolerance) &&
00397             (std::fabs(this->mCoords[2] - compare_to.mCoords[2]) < tolerance));
00398   }

00400   // Length functions
00401   inline double Vector3D::length_squared() const
00402   {
00403     return (mCoords[0]*mCoords[0] +
00404             mCoords[1]*mCoords[1] +
00405             mCoords[2]*mCoords[2]);
00406   }
00407   inline double Vector3D::length() const
00408   {
00409     return std::sqrt(mCoords[0]*mCoords[0] +
00410                           mCoords[1]*mCoords[1] +
00411                           mCoords[2]*mCoords[2]);
00412   }
00413   
00414   inline double inner_product( const Vector3D* v1, const Vector3D* v2, size_t n )
00415   {
00416     double result = 0.0;
00417     const Vector3D* const end = v1 + n;
00418     while (v1 < end) {
00419       result += *v1 % *v2;
00420       ++v1;
00421       ++v2;
00422     }
00423     return result;
00424   }
00425 
00426   inline double length_squared( const Vector3D*  v, int n )
00427   {
00428     double sum = 0.0;
00429     for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00430       sum += v[i].length_squared();
00431     return sum;
00432   }
00433   inline double length_squared( const std::vector<Vector3D>& v )
00434   {
00435     double sum = 0.0;
00436     for (size_t i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i)
00437       sum += v[i].length_squared();
00438     return sum;
00439   }
00440 
00441   inline double length(const Vector3D*  v,int n) // norm for an array of Vector3Ds
00442   {
00443     return std::sqrt( length_squared( v, n ) );
00444   }
00445   inline double length( const std::vector<Vector3D>& v )
00446   {
00447     return std::sqrt( length_squared( v ) );
00448   }
00449 
00450   inline double Linf(const Vector3D*  v,int n) // max entry for an array of Vector3Ds
00451   {
00452     double max=0;  
00453     //loop over the length of the array
00454     for(int i=0;i<n;++i){
00455       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][0]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][0]) ;
00456       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][1]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][1]) ;
00457       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][2]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][2]) ;
00458     }
00459     //return the value of the largest entry in the array
00460     return max;
00461   }
00462 
00463   inline double Linf( const std::vector<Vector3D>& v ) // max entry for an array of Vector3Ds
00464   {
00465     double max=0;  
00466     //loop over the length of the array
00467     for(size_t i=0;i<v.size();++i){
00468       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][0]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][0]) ;
00469       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][1]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][1]) ;
00470       if ( max < std::fabs(v[i][2]) )   max=std::fabs(v[i][2]) ;
00471     }
00472     //return the value of the largest entry in the array
00473     return max;
00474   }
00475 
00476   inline void Vector3D::set_length(const double new_length)
00477   {
00478     double factor = new_length / length();
00479     *this *= factor;
00480   }
00481   inline void Vector3D::normalize()
00482   { set_length(1.0); }
00483 
00484   // Utility functions.
00485   inline Vector3D Vector3D::interpolate(const double param,
00486                                         const Vector3D &p1,
00487                                         const Vector3D &p2)
00488   {
00489     return (1-param)*p1 + param*p2;
00490   }
00491 
00492   inline bool operator==( const Vector3D& v1, const Vector3D&v2 )
00493     { return v1.mCoords[0] == v2.mCoords[0] &&
00494              v1.mCoords[1] == v2.mCoords[1] &&
00495              v1.mCoords[2] == v2.mCoords[2]; }
00496 
00497   inline bool operator!=( const Vector3D& v1, const Vector3D&v2 )
00498     { return v1.mCoords[0] != v2.mCoords[0] ||
00499              v1.mCoords[1] != v2.mCoords[1] ||
00500              v1.mCoords[2] != v2.mCoords[2]; }
